sentences: Näljasena keeras kinni kõik, mis ette anti.
context: The Estonian word 'keeras' is the partitive form of 'keera' which means to turn or twist. In this context, it's used with 'kinni' (shut/closed) to mean shutting something off or closed. It can be used for closing taps/faucets ('kraani'), turning off devices like radios ('raadio'), locking doors ('ukse lukku'), and colloquially can refer to eating/drinking everything available when hungry.
